intro: Ancistrocladus abbreviatus subsp. lateralis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in short inflorescences, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying tropical flora.
